images.caption: Marston Marshes and swans in River Yare

description: This pretty nature reserve is located on the River Yare near Cringleford and Norwich. The reserve includes pleasant riverside trails, 5 ponds, damp woodland and floodplain grazing marsh with cattle. It's great for wildlife watching with species such as water voles, otters, snipe and geese to look out for. There's a car park at the eastern end of the site where you can pick up a waymarked circular nature trail running for just under 2 miles. The Yare Valley Walk starts/finishes at the reserve. You could pick up this 6 mile trail and follow it north to the man made broad in the pleasant grounds of the University of East Anglia.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The reserve is a popular place for dog walkers so you will probably see other owners on a fine day.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Edith Cavell Pilgrimage Walk passes through the reserve on its way from Swardeston to Norwich Cathedral. The walk pays homage to the heroic nurse of the first world war.
